channel.title: multiprocessing on Memo Tut
channel.description: Recent content in multiprocessing on Memo Tut

item.title: [Python] RPC completed with Python3 standard module
item.description: ## table of contents -There are too many types of Python RPCs today -Value that can be executed with standard library -Code description -Try it out There are too many types of Python RPCs today As of 2020, many RPCs have been published as OSS, but there are too many types, and the increase in selection cost, the increase in evaluation cost, and the increase in learning cost are personal issues.

item.title: [Python] [Python] A note when accelerating genetic algorithms using multiprocessing
item.description: #Introduction If you google Google and parallel processing, you will see many articles about the module called multiprocessing, so I tried it in the article I wrote before. [Python] Trying optimization of FX systre parameter with genetic algorithm The genetic algorithm evaluates many individuals and performs genetic processing such as selection and crossover according to their fitness, but since the evaluation of each individual is completely independent, it is suitable for parallel processing.
